inn1.comm: 143ks first up, no swing, spears it full and outside off, Kusal jabs with an angled bat and runs an outside edge to third man
Starc finds some inswing now, pretty full in length, Dilshan nearly falls over as he flicks. Mis-hits towards midwicket
pretty full and outside off, Dilshan doesn't need any second invitations for the drive. His foot does not meet the pitch. Reaches out with hard hands and slashes an outside edge to third man
Starc goes too full and down the leg side, swings away further, excellent take by Wade, flying to his right

bowled'em! Wicket no.99 for Starc. Lurking behind Saqlain. 141ks, Pretty full again, this time the line is bang on target. On the off stump, angled in. Perera hacks across the line and can't touch it. Starc bursts through the gate and barges into Kusal's castle. Success in his first over for the visitors. The off stump is knocked out. What a sight for a fast bowler!
pitched up and angled away outside off, tempter. Mendis is drawn into a drive and is beaten
143ks full and outside off again, Mendis chases. Jabs to the slip cordon. Does not carry to Finch
overpitched and outside off, driven out to the covers
back of a length and goes straight on outside off, Mendis plays as late as possible. Dabbing it down to third man
Hazlewood puts it on a good length outside off, it kicks up and screams at Dilshan. Skirts past the outside edge of the hanging bat
Hazlewood now brings out his carving knife and chops Dilshan into half. Seams back in sharply from outside off, bursts through the gate and bounces over the top of the off stump
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Dilshan throws his hands at a jabbing drive. Mistimed back to Hazlewood
full incoming delivery at off stump, Dilshan stretches forward and pushes it down the ground, towards mid-on for one
nice and full outside off, tips forward and middles a drive to the covers. Lovely front-foot stride
Starc drags his length back on off stump, 141ks, Mendis is on his tippy toes blunting it to the off side
143ks, flies through to Wade. Bouncer, angling away, Mendis handled it manly. Swayed his upper body out of the way. Good cricket all round
Mendis jumps and gets on top of a short one angled away outside off, punched out to point
very full and outside off, 144.2ks, another nice-looking drive, but straight to cover
nice and full, 142ks, leaves Mendis outside off. Whistles past the outside edge. Starc is cranking it up
back of a length and seams in to rap Dilshan on the front thigh in line with middle. Would have bounced over. Umpire Dar shot down the lbw appeal. The batsman toppled over the flick
another incoming delivery, back of a length, pushed down the ground
Hazlewood tests Dilshan with a chest-high lifter outside off. He rolls his wrists on it, tames it, and pulls down towards fine leg
length and angled in, Mendis uses the angle and tucks to the right of the square-leg ump
attempted short ball, barely rises bail-high, does not come onto the bat either. Dilshan pulls and sends a thick inside edge that runs away past the leg stump
the slowness of the surface to the fore, again. Dug in short and outside off, Dilshan, having shimmied out, has ample time to pull it from outside off to the midwicket fence
good length and angling away in the channel outside off, 141ks, Mendis ignores it
rapped on the glove is Mendis! Climbs from a length on the leg stump, awkwardly fended away to leg. Beaten by pace as well as bounce
Starc throws it full and wide outside off, Dilshan sinks his teeth into it. Slashed down to third man
back of a length and angling away outside off, Mendis gets on top of it, punching to point
leaps off the surface on its way to Wade. Bangs a bouncer outside off, Mendis attempts an air-borne cut and only connects with a whole lot of thin air
Starc now ventures full on the stumps, Mendis sits back, probably expecting more chin music. Camps back and taps it to cover
length ball, goes straight on off stump, Dilshan drives with hard hands. Played back to the bowler
length and outside off, that did not bounce at all. Dilshan stooped low and poked it out to cover
good-length ball angled in, picked away through vacant midwicket
banged in short and angled in at off stump, fended to leg
back of a length and rises outside off, Mendis rises with it, and rides it past lone slip. Faulkner slides to his left from third man, cutting it off to two
full and straight, easily worked through the square-leg region
full on middle, no lateral shape, pushed back to the bowler
wide half-volley, slapped to Bailey with the floppy hat at point
pitched up at off stump, Mendis presses forward and drives it to extra cover
Mendis aims for a leg-side flick. Faulkner rolls his fingers across this wily slower ball, 124ks, and earns a leading edge. But it does not carry to lone slip
fuller and outside off, dabbed to short extra cover
Mendis steps out to meet this one early. Back of a length on middle, tucked square on the leg side to break what could have been a maiden
bangs a short ball outside off, climbs to the keeper. Mendis locked his eyes on it before dropping his gloves. Umpire Dar suggests one for the over
that's simply regal! Pitched up on off stump, Mendis moves forward and loft-punches it over mid-on. Clean. One-bounce four
Henriques pulls his length back and gives width, square-cut away behind point for one
length ball angled in, flicked towards midwicket
back of a length and outside off,  cut to deep backward point
Henriques' line is wonky, with fine leg inside the circle. Picked off the thigh through backward square leg. Easily done
looks like a full cutter on off stump, Dilshan pushes early as an inside edge rolls back to Faulkner
very full and aiming for the middle stump, Dilshan's whip to mid-on intervenes

Dropped by Finch, he has lost it under the sun. Joy for the Sri Lanka fans in the stands. It's a sell-out crowd, mind you. Full on middle and leg, 111ks slower one, Mendis goes low and picks it up in the air. The ball did not come on and the batsman couldn't keep the sweep down. Finch, with the sun squinting into eyes, can't hang onto the overhead catch. His head looks away, and in the turn, the eyes, as he parries the ball away to the square leg boundary. Finch wouldn't want to look at the replays
full and outside off, slower ball at 111ks, pushed to extra cover
low full toss, tapped away for one
turned to the leg side
flashed away to cover
full on middle and leg, clipped through backward square leg. Dilshan, who is three months away from turning 40, comes back for the second
veering into the pads, diverted off the pads behind square on the leg side
very full on off, crisply driven down to mid-on
pitched up on the stumps, tip and run single to mid-on
slides on short and wide outside off, goes back and cuts it to point, where Bailey makes a tumbling save
looped up and comes in, googly? Mendis pokes an inside edge onto the pad
Zampa goes short but does not give much width, chopped off the back foot to cover
slower through the air on off, Mendis allows the ball to come to him and deflects it to short fine leg
Zampa whirls down a slider now, Dilshan jabs and is beaten past the outside edge. Wade whips the bails off. TV umpire called in. Dilshan's back foot never left the ground. Easy call for umpire Gough
Zampa lobs a full toss on middle, Dilshan punches it down the ground for one

The Dilscoop goes awry for Dilshan. Not a happy return for the old pro. Henriques finds some extra bounce outside off, which foils Dilshan's shot. And the ball isn't coming on here. He top-edges it, hit the helmet, and ballooned in the air. Smith runs in from point and settles under the catch
full at of stump, played back to the bowler
Henriques slips in a cutter outside off, finds extra bounce from the parched surface. Chandimal hops, gets on top of it, and runs it down to third man
short and some with outside off, rocks back and cuts firmly to Smith at point
full and on the stumps, forward and pushed down the ground. Mid-off runs to his right and throws himself on the ground to cut that off
lobs a full toss on off, Chandimal could have latched onto it. Instead, he simply taps it to extra-cover
tossed full on middle, defended back to the bowler
short legbreak outside off, ample time to skip back and cut through the covers
another short quick legbreak outside off, the batsman cuts perilously close to first slip off a thick outside edge. Smith dives to his right and only finger-tips it away to third man
full and outside off, pushed down to long-off
slides on middle and leg, Mendis unleashes a slog-sweep, but Finch at deep midwicket hunts it down

an appeal for lbw, umpire Martinesz does not budge. Smith chats with Zampa and calls for a review. Pushed through on leg stump, pitches in line, no turn, beats the inside edge. Mendis plays across the line, against this straight delivery, and misses. Was that heading down leg? Hitting the outside of the leg stump. Umpire's call on review, and Australia's review amounts to nothing
shortish on middle and leg, clipped away through backward square leg
back of a length on middle, punched out to midwicket
short and outside off, dabbed away past backward point
short on middle, rides the bounce, and helps it through backward square leg
banged in short on middle, does not climb much. The batsman rises and pats it down like a master does his gambolling puppy
back of a length and outside off, pushed to cover as Bailey swoops down on the ball and ensure that's a dot
flatter on middle and leg, straight ball, sweeps it away behind square leg. Finch runs to his right and swats the ball into the field of play with a slide, even as he touched the ad boards
tossed up, pushed down the ground
dabbed to extra cover
drags this legbreak short and outside off, on the back foot, punching to extra cover
lobbed up outside off, straight ball, tapped to the covers again
flighted legbreak just a shade outside off, Chandimal steps forward and smothers it to cover
back of a length at off stump, pushed out towards point
back of a length and cuts away outside off, beats the outside edge
looks like a cutter from Faulkner, slices an outside edge through cover

this explodes from a length and surprises Chandi. Was that the back of the hand slower ball? No he rolls his fingers across it. From the front of the hand. Pitches on middle and kicks at Chandi.  Pings the glove and rolls to leg
shorter and outside off, cut away for one
slower one again, full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on
lobs this up on off and gets a hint of turn, dabbed with soft hands to cover on the front foot
slides on with the arm on off, tapped towards point now
flatter and quicker legbreak, Mendis jabs and keeps it out off an inside edge
Zampa errs short and outside off, Mendis crouches and pulls over midwicket. Finch into the fray again
looped up and outside off, stopped at Mendis. Check-pushed down to long-off
slides on middle and leg, Chandi stands tall and forces it to midwicket
length ball on off, Mendis presses forward and bunts it down towards mid-off

dies a couple of centimetres in front of Bailey at short extra cover. Faulkner has his hands on his head. Faulkner sucks pace off this outside off, Mendis searches for a leg-side flick, plays early. The front edge does not carry despite Bailey throwing himself in front
length and outside off, eased to point
front of the hand cutter outside off, grips in the surface, and leaves Mendis. Beaten past the outside edge
looks like another slower ball, poked down the ground

full on leg stump, Mendis attempts another pick-up shot. Lofts the ball over from midwicket. Head chases the ball manfully but only comes second in the race. He couldn't flick the ball back into the field of play
shorter and outside off, square-cut away for one
full and outside off, punched to extra cover
might have been a googly, Mendis prods from the crease and inside-edges it past the leg stump

tossed up, full on middle, goes for the slog-sweep and miscues it in the air. Midwicket runs back, the man in the deep rushes in, mid-on moves to his right. But the ball eludes all three. Mendis living dangerously
straight delivery, played back to the bowler
flatter on leg stump, firmly swept away now through backward square leg
full and outside off, opens the face, drives, and finds the gap at extra cover
length and angling away outside off, patted to point
good length cutter moves away outside off, after gripping in the surface, Chandi waits for it and nurdles it fine of third man for a couple. Smart batting and running to boot
full and too straight, Chandi whips a single through square leg
deflected off the thigh to short fine leg
length ball cutter, leaves the right-hander outside off. He feebly hangs his bat out outside off and is lavishly beaten.
nails a yorker on off from wide of the crease, 140ks, squeezed back to the bowler
length and outside off, Chandi throws his hands at this outside off. Looks to drive and ends up toe-ending it to mid-off
too full and angled in from wide of the crease, delightfully whipped away through backward square leg. Not as stylish as Dhananjaya, though
full and bang on of stump, presses forward and creams a drive straight to mid-off

good length on off, Mendis wants a tip-and-run single. Chandi doesn't. There is a mix-up in the middle. Warner swoops down on the ball from backward point but can't splatter the stumps at the non-striker's end. Misses the chance. He could have caught Mendis short by a looooong way
141.6ks, overpitched and outside off, Chandi leans into a pretty drive. Extra cover dives to his left and takes some pace off it. Only two
length-ball offbreak, swept to square leg, the fielder dives to his left and stops the ball
tossed up high, punched down the ground. Smoothly done
goes low and misses the sweep, hits the pad outside the line of off
dangles this wide outside off and finds some turn, does not threaten off. Left alone
straighter ball on off, bends forward and nudges it to midwicket
Chandi goes low and shuffles outside off to take this one on the full. Smartly swept to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, punchily played to cover
back of a length and angling away outside off from over the wicket, this does not bounce at all. Slides under the slashing bat
good length and angling away outside off. Chandi who is standing on leg stump follows the ball and watches it beat the outside edge
back of a length and on the hips, swatted away behind square on the leg side
overpitched a shade outside off, tapped to extra cover
fractionally short and not much room outside off, leans back and chops to point
Head gives this loads of air, worked to leg
swept from outside off to deep midwicket
tossed up slow again, Chandimal races at Head. The ball dips, creating some distance between the bat and the swinging bat. Ends up dragging an inside edge to the leg side
slides on, hits the pad outside off. Chandi may have tickled it off an inside edge
pushed through on off stump, Mendis goes low hunting for a sweep. Top-edges it over the square-leg fielder

Half-century for Mendis. Fourth fifty in his eighth ODI. Continues to trouble Australia. Back of a length offbreak, dabbed with the spin to square leg. Mathews is up on his feet applauding from the change room
short and close to of stump, chopped down to third man
Chandi charges down the track and drills it off the inside half to mid-on. He wants to break free
good length and angled in, tapped down the ground, mid-on is now in the deep
short and outside off, cracks a cut and finds point
shortish and outside off, shovelled away to sweeper cover
length and outside off, punchily driven to extra cover
tossed-up legbreak on off, dead-batted to where silly point may have been
slower through the air outside off, forward and caressed to the covers
dropped way short and outside off, flat-bat wallop to long-off
pushed through outside off, swept away to deep square leg
lobs a full toss on the stumps, punched down to long-on
darted short and outside offf, flat-batted fiercely to long-off again
a gentle little glide to point, and a great big hurry to get to the other end

a little nip-backer that has Mendis twisted around like a pretzel. He was set up for a pull shot, playing the original line of the ball, but Hazlewood moves it off the seam and cramps him. Single to midwicket
straight lines are easy for Sri Lankan batsmen, Chandimal works it away to deep square leg

"yeah, yeah," yelps Chandi and poor Mendis, he's soaking in sweat, has to put in a dive and add dirt onto his uniform as well. That laundry bill is going to be a monster. Steven Smith taking any chance he can get to give it to Sri Lanka, running in from point quickly and underarming the throw
tails in, but it does so early enough that Mendis can spot it and nudge towards midwicket
shortish and just outside off, Mendis covers the line and knocks it to short midwicket

sweeps from the stumps, but he has managed it so well! It's tossed up and drifting in, it is bound to turn, but somehow he gets on top of it and laces it with enough power to beat the man in the deep. Risky, but superbly executed
short one, spots his exit at point and takes it

lucky again! He mistimed a slog sweep earlier, and now he just about beats point running back. Mendis was beaten in flight as he charged out, and as such the ball turns and makes him reach away from his body as he drives.
stays back and slaps a flatter delivery through point

slog sweep, the little man muscles it away! And there had to be plenty behind it to beat Warner at deep midwicket. It was a fairly short ball, Mendis could have pulled it, if he hadn't premeditated a sweep
moves across on off stump and drives to long-on

walllllllloppped away to long leg! For fast bowlers, this pitch is the equivalent of that little corner in class where the dunce is sent to. And Hazlewood makes it worse by bowling short. Mendis swivels on the back foot and pulls away
good length ball outside off, driven smartly to the left of mid-off
shortish on off stump, Chandimal waits a bit as the ball holds up on the pitch and nudges it to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, tucked towards short fine leg
cuts back in, the pace is at 133kph so it might not be an offbreak. Chandimal was whipping across the line and was beaten
sweetly struck to point as Chandimal waited on the back foot for a late could, had he been a touch more patient he could have had a boundary at third man

got 'im! One mistake too many for Mendis as he pulls too early, gets a top edge and offers a dolly of a catch - for once where the fielder was. Head at midwicket takes it and Australia celebrate, giving thanks to Faulkner's offcutter slower ball holding in the pitch

beautiful bowling from Faulkner. He has understood that this dry pitch is giving him plenty for the offcutter. And he lands it a the perfect spot - on a full length on leg stump to tempt the batsman to play across the line. Beats the outside edge
extra bounce now! Solid puff of dust from the surface and Mathews who had been caught in the crease trying to defend suddenly has one lurching at him.
back of a length and outside off, pushed to cover

double-wicket over, and Head should deserves a lot of credit for this one. Takes an outstanding catch at point! Faulkner tempts the drive with a wide half-volley, Mathews takes the bait but should have gone after it harder. Head at point moves nimbly to his left, leaps up and takes it with both hands over his head
full and just outside off, defended and Faulkner finishes a double-wicket maiden.
good length ball speared in from around the stumps, Chandimal deflects it towards point
shortish and fairly wide, Chandimal cuts carefully to point
meets it with a serene drive all along the ground to deep cover. Gentle treatment a full toss didn't deserve

almost, but there was no one at short midwicket to threaten this false stroke into becoming a bad stroke. Starc works the angle from around the stumps and the dry pitch holds onto the ball oh so lovingly, Chandimal flicks goes uppishly
back you vile full toss says de Silva with a lovely, wristy flick through square leg
good length ball far too wide for this format. Chandimal leaves, looks at the umpire and gets what he wanted
fuller delivery outside off, driven towards mid-off and we'll all take a drink and spoil ourselves
fuller ball outside off, driven to long-off. Pressure on Chandimal to turn this into a long innings

nicely played. Faulkner is getting the ball to break sharply off the deck, so de Silva keeps his bat as close as possible, opens it towards point and plays as late as possible. Well in control of the glide
a little shorter, which affords him a little more time to play with, clipped away to deep midwicket
fuller delivery at 117 kph, defended cautiously
made him reach a touch with the offcutter at 118 kph, Chandimal handles it well enough with an angled face of the bat

falls just short of the bowler! Faulkner remains a constant threat when his line is straight. Batsman from the subcontinent invariably like swat those away through midwicket, but on this slow, dry pitch, Chandimal has to check his shot and he nearly pops one back off the leading edge
beaten by the slower ball from Starc! The open face of the bat flirts with the line of the ball before it even arrives - it's full and it dances on through

100 ODI wickets, and he is the fastest ever to that mark in cricket history! Big, tall, scary fast bowler makes history with a innocuous, pace-less, slow old teaser. Ah, irony. Starc had de Silva reaching outside off, thinking it was up there for a cover drive, but the ball holds in the pitch and pops over to short midwicket. Bailey moves to his right, dives and secures it. Brilliant piece of deception from Starc, and sign that he is evolving.
back of a length and outside off, slid to third man

inside edge, with the new batsman in, one who hasn't faced him too much on this tour - last time, possibly in the practice match before the Tests - Siriwardana tries a dab to third man and nearly loses his stumps
oooh, delicate little late cut from Chandimal, but he placed it too fine. Wicketkeeper Wade moves swiftly to his right and stops a certain boundary
good length ball drilled through the covers
offcutter on middle, nurdled to midwicket
leans into a fuller ball outside off and drives into the covers
stood up tall, or at least tried to, against the back of a length ball and squirts to through midwicket with the break on the ball

good bowling this, no one's bothering to put any pace on the ball. Instead they roll their fingers along the side, it makes them bite into the pitch and misbehave. The 103 kph good length ball very wide outside off sneaks under the cutting bat
full and wide, Siriwardana attempts an unswise drive with the open face of the bat, pushing at a ball that seems very reluctant to come to him after pitching. Outside edge wanders to third man
shortish and outside off, dabbed towards cover point. Chandimal will keep strike, which may well be good for Sri Lanka
nudges it from off stump to deep square leg with great ease, that's how slow the pitch is
too short and Siriwardana nails the first shot he has today - a cut to deep point
moves across in line with a slider just outside off and blocks

good running from Siri! With his fresh legs, he knew he could make the danger end. Chandimal came forward to block, got an inside edge towards short square leg, and the keeper had to go after it himself, then turn around to throw by which time Siri was back
tossed up outside off, driven to cover. "Nooooooooo," Chandimal banshees!

just wide of first slip! Beautiful bowling from Head, having plied him and Chandimal with flat darts, he decides to throw this up with a little more flight. Siri comes forward tentatively and gets an outside edge. Smith at first slip dives to his left but can't grab it
back of a length and outside off, dabbed towards point
offcutter, but Siri spotted it early and slices it towards the covers for a quick single. Needs to concentrate on those to make sure he gets set
fuller ball on middle and leg, tucked behind square leg
full on the base of off stump, sent to cover
shortish and outside off, slapped to Head at point. There's a sentence I didn't think I'd say out loud
greets the full offcutter with an equally full face of the bat.
width offered and Chandimal spurns it with a chops straight to point
aims a full inswinger on the base of middle and off, Chandimal does well to keep his toes out of the way and flick to short midwicket
another yorker, tinged with reverse swing, Chandimal handled it well in the Tests and does so here too, playing late and playing with the inswing
waits for the tail - and it is rather late so good on Hazlewood for that - but Chandimal's been in long enough to adjust his batspeed and bring it to meet the ball on the base of middle stump
offcutter towards the end of the over, Chandimal reads it out of the hand, is helped by the ball being short too, dabs behind point
nicely done, he had to hit against the cut, but it wasn't prominent as Faulkner's. Siri plays late and close to his body as well to dilute the threat and gets a single to square leg
some turn, but slow turn, which allows Siri to adjust. He had made room to cut and ended up having too much of it. Checks his shot and keeps it to ground. Single to point

appeal for a stumping from the wicketkeeper after Head runs through Chandimal! Loops it up, slows it down, gets the ball to turn and hurtle through the gate as the batsman defends. But credit to him, as far forward as he was lunging, the backfoot was down and did not move out of the crease
fifty for Chandimal! A very responsible innings from the vice-captain. This was one of the easier runs he's gotten today, a ball on the pads, flicked away.
that's just gorgeous! He moves inside the line of the ball and chips a tossed up ball over cover. Magnificent timing
eased through the covers again, this time along the ground. Siri has understood the pace of the deck.
tossed up outside off, whipped to long-on
back of a length on off stump, Chandimal drops an open face on it like a ton of bricks and scampers off to the other end to evade punishment

just lobs over mid-on! Perhaps he wasn't expecting the short ball, or for the short ball to come at him at good pace. Must have been a lot of effort behind it from Hazlewood. The top-edge lands safely
fuller delivery outside off, driven towards cover
slots it into the gap in front of point and the good length ball amounts to runs
plays around an offcutter, and enjoys an inside edge onto his pads. Would have been plumb otherwise. Not too wise a shot to be playing on a slow pitch that offers purchase for cutters
wanders out of his crease and takes a full ball from outside off and drags it to deep midwicket

some bounce on the offcutter, Chandimal rides it well with a tuck through to square leg, Bailey sensed a run-out chance and swooped on the ball early. Concentration drifted to throwing the ball too early and he misfields
sweet connection on the cut shot as Siriwardana waits on the back of a length ball to come to him
stays low, but the offcutter doesn't trouble Chandimal who pats it down the pitch
fuller ball on off stump, whipped to deep square leg
defends a good length ball on leg stump, but since it was laced with offcut the ball pops out towards where silly mid-off might have been
through the gap at cover! Siri goes aerial against the length ball, pretty much your standard ODI shot provided the pitch was true. Times it well, though and places it just about perfectly
tinge of reverse into the left-hander, nudged towards midwicket
inside edge to a 140 kph delivery scalping for the middle of middle. Siri plays from the crease and doesn't know where the ball had gone until Chandi was rushing up at him
heaves at it, but he has to settle for another pesky inside edge to long leg. Full and tailing in on off stump
ripper of a toecrusher, at 141 kph too. But Chandimal is superb too, keeps so still in the crease, brings that bat down in line with middle stump and saves himself. Cricket, you beauty!
another yorker, and this might have reverse away and beaten the outside edge. He was also beaten for pace, but the good thing was Chandimal was playing with a straight bat.

lovely bowling from Starc, luckless bowling too. He pulls his length back, and has perhaps gone a little too short to get the outside edge. Reverse swing away from the bat and Chandimal was squared up, his legs on leg stump and his hands reaching out
shortish and outside off, sliced through to point
bounds out to meet the slower ball on off stump and yorks himself for his trouble
runs down the track and harrumphs it down to long-on. Chandimal's decided to accelerate now.
moves away to leg stump, the fast bowler follows him with a short one, pulled away to deep square leg

struck on the ribs and he goes down! He had run down the track, Henriques reacts with an offcutter that digs into the pitch and leaps up at the batsman. Chandimal was trying to hack across the line on instinct and is struck on the ribs. He crumpled over immediately, had enough fight in him to go back into his crease but he needs serious medical attention now. I remember Pietersen wearing one like that from McGrath and going out of action for a while.
pitched up fuller now, the offcutter is Henriques' safely blanket. Sticks in the surface. Chandi waits back in the crease and flips it around to the midwicket region

Starc thinks he has Chandi caught behind. Umpire Martinesz says no. Australia have used up their review. Wide of the crease, and gets it to straighten outside off.  Chandi drives as the ball carries to the keeper. But, I don't think there was a nick there. Or was it? Tight call

too straight in line, Chandi flicks it to midwicket with a whirl of the whirl of the wrists. Head throws it on the half-volley to the keeper. Overthrows. Two runs. Good awareness from Chandi. Hares back for the second, despite the blow on the ribs
angles a full toss outside off, dabbed to third man

good length and outside off, Siriwardana's bottom hand flies off the bat as he chips a catch to mid-off, running to his right. The ball stopped at Siriwardana, who checked his loft hit and simply lobbed a catch to Finch. Stroke making is very difficult on this parched surface
Starc dishes out an off-stump full toss, sliced to point
wide of the crease, full and holds its line on middle, whipped down to long-on
full and angled into the right-hander, flicked away
short enough that Chandimal can rock back and cut, but it's straight to the sweeper
lovely connection first ball, which was slow too. Not many at that pace has been middled, but it was on the pads. Flicked to long leg

113 kph, you little beauty! Thisara's calling card is the mow over midwicket, but here he gets Sri Lanka's first boundary in over 15 overs with a delicate little leg glance that sends the roof off of Khettarama

Look ma, I can hit it with my eyes closed! He was walking down the track, wandering away outside off. Henriques the enraged bowls a short ball, Thisara ducks and wafts at the ball with his bat and scoops it over short fine leg, half intending to do so, half hoping to avoid getting hit
offcutter to finish on a good length, holds in the pitch to ruin Thisara's drive on the up
lovely hit to long-on! Thisara takes three, and the crowd's roar is back up at full volume. A near yorker has been met, measured and mastered by the big-hitter

smirks at the batsman after his reverse swing makes him look like a tail-ender. Oh, you naughty fast bowlers. You just can't settle for picking wickets, can you? It's a fast, full ball angled in on off stump from around the wicket, beats the big old drive over mid-off
low-arm, round-arm yorker on middle and leg, Chandimal blocks it to the left of the bowler, who dives and sends him scurrying back in the crease. Outstanding from Starc
strides forward to drive a 139 kph delivery outside off looking to drive it, but that Starc ball says "nya nya" as it sneaks off to the keeper
misses a full toss outside off and Starc throws him another good-natured grin.

steers a very full delivery outside off to deep third man. That's the end of Starc for this game, three wickets, the second of which made him the fastest bowler, in terms of matches, to 100 ODI wickets

chance at the non-strikers'! It was a slightly short one on middle and off, Chandimal drags it with a pull straight to Smith at short midwicket. He has one stump to aim at, Thisara's is way out of his crease, the throw comes in and it wanders away past the target. Smith looks at his hand as if it were some traitor
good shot, he's speared a full length through the infield, and has placed it fine enough that the sweeper cover couldn't get there either. Excellent cricket
back-to-back beauties from Chandimal! A perfectly good length ball has been ever so gently corrupted by a touch of the open bat face and it races away to the third man boundary
moves around the wicket and angles it in, picked away to midwicket
looks for the wide yorker, Thisara was moving across his stumps and whips it through midwicket for a couple that brings up the Sri Lankan 200
oooh, he was eyeing that. He was eyeing that for a six. The back of the hand slower ball arrives and dupes Thisara because it was too slow and too wide of his reach
full on off stump, Chandimal plays it down to long-on
short and wide, hammers it off the bottom of the bat to cover
backs away to try and cut the ball off the stumps, but the cutter beats him and only just misses off stump. Thisara gets a talking to from Chandimal
targets the pads and Thisara whips it in the air to the right of deep midwicket, falls just short of Smith running in

tails in on middle - rapid reverse swing - and Chandimal was almost thrown off his feet. Manages to get his bat down in time for a single through midwicket. Hazlewood appealed thinking it was pad, but it was all wood
cuts from the stumps and his power takes care of the result! There was point, there was short third man and he beats both of them to their left. Fierce!
slower ball on off stump, Chandimal tucks it towards mid-on, Smith from midwicket hurtles in and keeps it to a single
half-volley outside off, Thisara plops his front leg aside and mauls it to extra cover.

that's a beaut! Thisara set up for the big old golf swing, but the back of the hand slower ball pitches in front of where the bat could reach, landed on the seam, kicks up and sashays past the outside edge

that is one heck of a catch from Wade running forward! But the fourth umpire has asked Thisara to wait, the third umpire will be taking a look at this. Thisara was wandering outside off stump for the scoop, Faulkner bowls it shorter and wider to complicate the shot. Desitined to be mistimed and Wade, with excellent presence of mind runs across, and boy is he quick! Had the ball in his sights all through, throws himself after the ball - he needed to, wouldn't have reached it otherwise - and catches it with his arms fully outstretched millimeters off the ground. Replays indicated the ball bounced up, and it did, but it was off Wade's gloves, not the ground. Umpire Gough did well to call that
whipped towards long leg
big appeal for leg before, but this hit the new Perera too high.
fuller ball on off stump, nudged towards midwicket
runs down the track for a good length ball and goes for a swat down the ground.  Wade misses a regulation take and gives a bye

extra bounce, and Chandimal is again in a spot where he has to fear for injury! His own fault to an extent for running at the fast bowler, who shortens his length and the ball gives him a little extra. Thankfully it robs some of the pace off the ball too which means Chandimal can get his hand up and protect his face
top shot! That's at his top pace, looking for the yorker on middle. Steered to deep point
that's helpful. Perera is beaten for pace as he tries to slice the ball behind point, but the angle and the offcut of the ball into him means the inside edge wanders to fine leg
oof, that would hurt a fast bowler's pride. Dilruwan has slog swept him for a boundary to midwicket. Could have been a six on other grounds.
low full toss outside off, sliced to point
goes for the lap sweep.... and picks out short fine leg! If he was intending to use the pace of the ball, there was very little on it. A 116 kph fuller ball on leg stump gives Faulkner his fourth
low full toss outside off, drilled to mid-off
beaten as he slogs across the line of a good length ball outside off
low full toss outside off, punched to mid-off

slices it to point, Bailey has a decision to make, whether to go for a catch or hang back. He decides he wants the wicket, dives forward, but can't get there. Good on him to put his body in line with it though

inn2.comm: soft ball - short and wide outside off - Warner latches onto it, crunching a cut in the gap at the covers
good length ball from over the wicket, straightens on off, Finch wafts an outside edge towards point
Mathews floats it full and outside off, Finch eases forward and launches it over mid-off. Handsomely lofted for the first six of the game. At that pace - 124 - Mathews was asking to be spanked
good riposte from Mathews. Finds some assistance from the surface. Length ball, explodes, a puff of dust explodes as well. Strikes Finch on the glove
short of a length and outside off, leans back and cuts to point. Dilshan is lurking there
leg-side wide, but replays indicate that may have glanced the thigh
back of a length on middle, does not come onto Finch, and shoots low. Finch is forced to go low with it. Jabs it to midwicket. Extra bounce first, now he has to deal with low bounce
slides on middle from round the wicket, tucked neatly through square leg
dragged down short and outside off, Warner has loads of time to skip back and cut to backward point

Dilshan's reaction suggests that there was a nick there. Dilshan slows it up, throws it up outside off. Warner slashes and nicks it thickly, past the right leg of Kusal who is behind the stumps, not Chandimal. It went past the keeper quickly. Not an easy chance
Finch steps away outside leg, Dilshan stalks him. Rasping pull. Nobody there at deep square leg to cut it off
full and straight, swept away to backward square leg
straight delivery on middle and leg, hacked away to wide long-on
short and tucks Finch up for room, pushed to the leg side on the back foot
back of a length and keeps low on off again, Finch crouches and keeps it out
big bounce! Jumps from a length outside off, beats the outside edge, beats Kusal as well. This pitch is a challenge for the keeper as well
Finch gets on top of a short ball on off. Punched to cover
back of a length and width outside off, Warner leans back for another cut. The 39-year-old Dilshan still has it. Makes a sprawling save at backward point
much tighter from Mathews. Pushes it full on middle, Warner pushes towards mid-off
heavo-ho. Finch has found his oasis. Pushed through on off, Finch stretches forward and smites a slog-sweep over midwicket. Only the second six of the match
tickled off the pads to short fine leg
no flight. Dilshan firing it on middle, Finch fights fire with fire. Brings out another slog. Swiped away between deep midwicket and long-on now. One-bounce boundary
darted on middle and leg, clipped to mid-on
Dilshan gives it some air on off, defended
length ball aiming for middle, Warner pushes out to mid-off
short on middle and leg, Warner has no room to work with. Sits back and jabs to midwicket
good length on middle and leg, Warner defends again, this time to cover
Warner leaps back and chops from the stumps to backward point, Dilshan fumbles now
straight in line, back of a length, Finch shuffles across off, whipping to midwicket
little nip-backer, cramps Finch for room. Jams an inside edge onto the pad. The snick trickles behind square on the off side
fractionally short and outside off, Warner scythes it away to backward point. Excellent diving save from Dilshan. Mathews offers the old pro a pat on the back
might have been a slower one around off, Warner employs soft hands and runs it down past Dilshan to third man
nice and tight, good length ball on middle, defensively played back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, Finch middles a punch to extra cover
Thisara rolls his fingers across the cutter, drifts down the leg side, past the glance. The umpire reckons it may have kissed the thigh
back of a length and too straight in line again, minimalist touch from Finch. No violence here. Just tickles it fine to the leg-side boundary
full cutter on middle, tapped to mid-off
full on middle, Warner keeps searching for room. Sri Lanka's aren't giving him enough breathing space. Defended
floated slower on the pads, Warner works it to midwicket and ticks it over to Finch
back of a length on off, stabbed to point
shorter and outside off, Finch jumps on top of it, punching it to the covers, Siri dives to his right from cover-point and keeps it to one
pitched up on the stumps, Warner steps forward and drives a quick single to mid-off
length on middle and leg, cramps Warner for space. Blocked

Perera earns the outside edge, Perera catches it! Warner swipes the turf as he walks back. Nice and full on middle, seams away, looked like Warner shaped to run it down to third man. Does not get enough bat on it. Edges it behind to the keeper. That should taste su-weet for Thisara after being smashed for over 100 in his last List A outing. There was no slip, which tempted Warner
back of a length on off, Smith has a short front-foot stride as he plays it back to the bowler
similar line and length, blocked to short extra cover
short and wide outside off, Smith wants to muscle a cut. In the end he loses his shape and chops tamely to point
length and curls away outside off past the outside edge
full and no lateral shape outside off, Finch steps forward and lays into it. Pumps it over mid-off. Another one-bounce four
length and outside off, stabbed to extra cover
chopped from outside off to third man
Mathews goes short and outside off, Finch dismisses it from his presence. Rasping cut dispatched to the point fence. Australia sprint to 50 inside nine overs
pitched up on off, open-faced dab into the covers
short on off, Finch sits back and forces it to mid-off
pitched up and outside off, no slip now, Smith outside-edges a drive to third man
Finch looks so good when he hits through the line! Pitched up and outside off, too full for Finch. He moves forward and pings it over mid-off
It does not matter that mid-off is pushed back. Finch eyes the leg side. Full and just outside off, Finch attacks it as well. Shovelling it over midwicket
102ks slower ball outside off, Finch waits, waits, waits.... Checks his stroke and dabs it to the right of extra cover
back of a length and on a fifth-stump line outside off, Smith defends with soft hands to the off side
short and outside off, not all that short, Smith just shuffles across off and whips it away stylishly behind square
full straight bat outside off, shovel-driven through the covers
sliding down the leg side, past the flick, leg-side wide
tossed up slower through the air, straight ball on middle, hits the front pad in line. Mathews does not go for the review. He reckons that was slapping down leg
full on middle, pokey drive back to the bowler
skidder from Aponso, shoots low, Smith somehow keeps it out

that's a ripper from Aponso. Saw Smith race at him. The debutant held his nerve and pulled his length back shorter. Drifts in and turns away with savage extra bounce, raps the glove, and runs past Mathews at lone slip
shorter and outside off, chopped to point
Finch brings up a half-century out of Australia's 66. He reaches the landmark by sweeping this length ball on middle to deep backward square leg. Good work from Mendis in the deep
flighted and turns away outside off, driven in the air over extra cover. He was not in control of it
smart stuff, tip and run single to cover
played through the covers for one
looped up outside off, wafted back to the bowler
short and outside off, pulled over midwicket. Mendis has a mix-up with another fielder in the deep and ends up conceding three runs
full on the stumps, punched down the ground
backs away and cuts through the covers for one

SL go up for a caught-behind appeal. Umpire Dar shakes his head. Big-turning break. Big bounce. Pitches on a fourth-stump line and rips away past the outside edge from a full length. Savage turner ends in Mathews' hands. How did that finish in slip's hands? Oh my....
follows the break with the skidder that pins Smith on the back foot. Rapped on the pad, but this was sliding down
pitches outside off and turns past the outside edge. Beaten
slides on quicker, kept out
shorter and outside off, bottom-edges the cut to the keeper
tapped to extra cover
tossed up wide outside off, scythed away to deep cover
Thisara rushes in from deep point but the skier lands in front of him. Looped up and turns away, Smith goes for the loft and ends up slicing it in the air. Gets lucky
straighter delivery, Finch plays for the turn and pokes an inside edge that rolls to square leg
looped up and spins away outside off, Smith plays with soft hands. Looks like edged it softly, does not carry to slip
slides on off stump, defended back

another appeal for caught behind. Not given. Umpire Dar's review. Mathews collected it cleanly. The on-field umpires want to check whether it was a bump ball. Certainly not. TV umpire Gough looks for the nick. There was a noise. It could have come from the bat thudding the ground. No visible deflection. No conclusive evidence, yet. Tight, tight call for Gough. He looks at various replays and rules Finch out. Nice, low take from Mathews. Finch looks disgruntled. Smith chats with the umpires. Aponso has his maiden international scalp. This pitched just outside off and spun sharply at Finch. He flung his bat down and gave an edge to slip. Hmm, not sure if there was an edge, though
swept from the stumps to fine leg
leg-stump line, Wade tickles it wide of the keeper. It would be tough to call that a chance
lobbed up, Wade defends
Wade brings out the sweep again, stroked through backward square leg
full and skids on outside off, Smith plays for the turn and is beaten past the outside edge
slides on middle, pushed down the ground
floated outside off, Wade goes low for the sweep and cue-ends it through square leg
breaking down the leg side, Smith aims to shovel it away. He is beaten, as is Kusal
straight delivery on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
slower offbreak, defended back to the bowler
length ball on off, Smith brings out the sweep now, hit to deep backward square leg
looped up on off, down the track and whipped to long-on
length ball outside off, turned to midwicket
floated on middle, swept squarer of short fine leg
full and straight outside off, Smith crunches a drive to sweeper cover
full and spins into Wade,  worked squarer of short fine leg again
drifts in on middle, Smith offers a straight bat in defence
back of a length and breaks away from the left-hander, jabbed to cover
looped up and drifts in the air, Wade, squeezes an inside edge
full and skids on outside off, Wade pre-meditates a sweep and misses. He falls over
loopier at off stump, pushed to the covers
Wade pre-meditates a sweep again, goes low, takes it from outside off and tickles it finer

slides on, Smith plays across the line and misses the sweep. Rapped on the front pad outside the line of off stump. Mathews wants a review for a catch. Kusal suggested that there was a nick. But replays detect no edge. Beaten on the inside is Smith. The tracker confirms that the impact was outside off. Umpire Martinesz's call is vindicated. Umpire Gough rules it in favour of Smith. SL lose their review
tossed up on the pads, patted to midwicket
slog swept from outside off to deep midwicket
flighted on off, Smith has a big stride as he defends
dropped short and outside off, Smith nos skips back, cutting away through cover
pushed through outside off, no turn, whipped to midwicket. Dilshan dives to his left and makes a smart stop
full and drifts in slightly on middle, Smith shows off his straight bat
length and outside off, Wade keeps sweeping, played to fine leg
picked away to midwicket
flighted and spins in, Wade nicks it onto the pad

Mathews drops the outside edge at slip. It wasn't easy, however. Dilruwan saw Smith coming at him. Held it back outside off. Smith wasn't to the pitch and checked his shot. He pokes and edges it. The ball deflects off the right glove/right thigh of Kusal, and Mathews can't hang on
pushed down the ground
turned around the corner
Wade brings out another busy sweep. Fetches it from outside off, and controls it. Played to deep square leg
and again! Tossed outside off, swept away towards deep midwicket now
full and drifts in a bit, played back to the bowler
back of a length and turns away outside off, goes back and punches to cover
that's beaut! Smith has a wry grin. Pitched on middle and leg, opens up Smith and eats him up for lunch. Tasty big-turning break. Whistles through to the keeper. He had to be too good to touch it
full on the stumps, pushed down the ground
looped outside off, jumps, and turns past the outside edge., Pulled Wade forward and beat him
full and straight outside off, laced down to long-off - Wade's first run on the offside
back of a length on middle, whipped on the back foot to midwicket
pitches outside off and turns past the outside edge of the prodding bat
flatter and outside off, leans back and punches through the covers. Wade gives the thumbs-up to his captain. Good intent. Two runs
hint of turn outside off, run away to cover
Wade aims a leg-side flick and is defeated by turn. Front edge does not carry to cover
full on middle, forward and eased to long-off
flighted and outside off, Wade snuggles under his safety blanket, sweeps and top-edges it wide of short fine leg
slides in with the arm, backs away and punches to cover
pitched up on middle, tapped to Dilshan at short extra cover
straight delivery on off, full in length, dabbed to the cover-point region for one
tossed full and straight on off, defended back to the bowler
sees some flight, Smith comes down the track, meets the pitch, and smartly chips over mid-off for the first boundary since the powerplay
breaking down leg, wide
length-ball offbreak, turned to midwicket
flat and fired it on middle, defended
full on middle, open-faced drive to cover
goes low, picks it from outside off and sweeps to square leg
Wade keeps sweeping, goes low and sweeps this fine on the leg side now
flat and fired outside off, goes back and punches it handsomely through backward point
spins sharply sharply into Smith and raps the front pad, impact outside the line of off
another magic ball, spins back savagely into Smith, whipped with the turn to midwicket
short and finds turn to the left-hander as well, pulled behind square
short and sliding down leg, googly, Wade swings and loses his shape. Wide

Maiden ODI wicket for Sandakan. No turn. Sandakan just throws this up outside off, Wade turns to his favourite sweep. He unfurls the slog sweep now. Middles it straight into the lap of Dilshan at short midwicket. The old fella nonchalantly plucks the catch
slow, tossed up on middle, defended
gift wraps a bit of width and Smith goes gung-ho over with with a cover drive

that's vicious turn! Siri tosses it up outside leg stump, the angle is steep, but it pitches and jerks away so sharply it looked good to hit leg stump. The squared up Bailey had no idea how to react to it, brings his bat down the wrong line, gets hit on the thigh and the ball lobs to slip. Sri Lanka appeal, but that's a great decision from umpire Martinesz
has him reaching outside off, with his legs stuck in some cement outside leg, could barely hope to touch the ball
fired in on middle and leg, this one slides on with the arm. Bailey taking guard outside leg, defends just in time
loads up a reverse sweep, and has to reach for a ball on sixth stump because of his stance outside leg. Mathews at slip does extremely well diving to his right
good shot, the sweep has worked for the Australians, and the captain uses it well, his wrists rolling over the ball to find the gap at long leg
comes down the track to take the ball on the full and drives to long-on
goes back and since the length is short he is able to read the variation - the one that goes straight - off the pitch and punch to cover
his guard is on middle stump now, and Sandakan draws him forward to defend with the flight. But then the ball dips and turns wildly past the inside edge.
pitches on middle and then turns further down leg, Bailey attempts a flick but he may as well have left the ball considering how far the ball turned. Great work from keeper Perera

uppish, but he gets off the mark! It's a slightly shortish delivery, Bailey went back to flick it away, thinking he had it easy. But the ball holds in the pitch and reaches the batsman who had almost completed his stroke. Short midwicket was there, but the ball goes to his left
lunges as far forward as he could to reach the ball and brutishly sweep it away to long leg
flighted on middle and leg, Smith defends with bat in front of pad. Soft hands, Smithy
reaches the pitch and tries to force the ball past the bowler, but Siri, along with two over fielders deny him a single. Dilshan, all of 39 years old, looks lightning on the field at short cover
drives down to long-off as Dilshan mimes putting the ball where the sweep results in a top edge
misfield on the point boundary and the panic stricken Bailey gets away with a reverse sweep. Terrible work by de Silva, diving past the ball
that's much better. That's how you impose yourself. Pick the length early - its short - jump back in the crease and throw your weight behind the shot. Creamed through cover
a little too full so Bailey doesn't have to worry about turn, he just drives through the line of the ball to long-off

premeditates a reverse sweep and is helped out by the ball being quite slow, and so tossed up that he can reach it almost on the full. Three to third man, excellent running from Smith, he senses Bailey is being troubled, he wants to take more of the strike
lovely batting, waited for the ball to come at him, doesn't take any decision to play until he has to and dabs the ball past short leg
backs away, and the turn on the ball takes the ball too far from him. Bottom edges the cut to point
gets the sweep out, appears to be a good option in Khettarama
tossed up just outside off, Smith lunges forward but can't quite  get to the pitch. Inside edge onto pad, short leg lurking

mid-off was up, Smith ran down the pitch and belts it over his head! Excellent batting from the captain, it seems to me he is trying to push Australia as close to the target as quick as possible. He knows this pitch, and this bowling, eats new batsman up for breakfast  and burps them to smithereens
tossed up on and around off stump, Bailey batting on leg stump has the room the drive through extra
a little turn, just enough to take Smith's outside edge. But the clever bit about that ball was making Smith reach out to drive
a flatter ball outside off, Smith goes back to cut and misses
leans into the drive and hits it with the turn, along the ground to deep cover. Purpose from Smith.
not entirely short for the cut, and the misjudgment of length doesn't cause Bailey too much harm. Lobs over his outside edge, and the stumps as well
that's almost too good, the ball is tossed up and angled in on off stump, Bailey plays a drive on the up and the ball cha-chas past the outside edge
good length ball going on with the arm, Smith blocks it down the pitch

stays back to block having read the ball off the pitch. Aponso's ability to slide the ball through on this pitch should be useful He almost bowls with the seam perpendicular to the pitch, so the ball always hits the leather and goes on
tossed up on middle, defended with a straight bat on middle
leans forward and defends
moves to his left and saves a single as Smith drives down the ground
that's a ripper! Slows it down so beautifully, does so by giving the ball a massive amount of loop. Even Smith is sucked into pushing at it. And is soundly beaten by turn and bounce
pushed through on middle and leg, defended towards short cover
batting outside leg, which comes in handy when the bowler pitches short. Almighty pull through straight midwicket. Bailey's been iffy, but he has got the bad ball away
another short one, Bailey pats it through to the sweeper
tossed up on middle and off, defended
delicious, says Smith as he picks the bones off a juicy old long hop! Leaps back and whip-pulls over midwicket

how do you play that?! Smith, having attempted to go back and defend a turning, bouncing, spitting-poison, twisting-the-world-on-its-head delivery, is beaten and walks down the pitch with a helpless smile
good length on off stump, defended
stays back and has all the time he needs to handle the flatter delivery outside off. On a slow pitch, that's the length the batsman wants the spinner to bowl. Pushed through point
goes back on middle, pushed down the pitch

rambunctious appeal for a catch at silly point. Smith had charged out, Aponso had pulled his length back and the slider hits the front pad, grazes the back pad, doesn't go anywhere near the bat and goes to the man under the lid
tossed up on middle, defended
looped up on off stump, Smith defends inside the line expecting no turn, but there is some. Gets an outside edge past slip. Smith gestures for a change of gloves.
good length ball outside off, driven into the covers
back of a length and outside off, steered past Dilshan at point. For once he comes up short. Sign of Sri Lanka slouching a bit?
comes in line with a short of a good length ball and meets it with a firm and straight bat

that's gorgeous from Smith! The ball is coming down on a straight line - Thisara should really bowl those cutters - so the batsman moves across and whips it away off his thighs past short fine leg. With that man up inside the circle, he had plenty of runs for the taking
good length ball outside off, defended to point
fuller ball outside off, driven to mid-off
tossed up on leg stump, pushed back
bunts a shortish delivery on middle back down the pitch, Aponso fielders it with a dive to his right
moves inside the line and drives to short cover
the bowler tried to stop it, first by bowling at the pads of Bailey who is batting on leg stump to open up the off side, and then moving to his left. But the drive beats him
pushed through down leg
takes the ball from outside off and the whiplash of his wrists are powerful enough to send it to deep square leg. Can't bowl that short on this pitch
flighted on middle and off, defended
goes back and slices the ball towards point

fuller ball outside off, driven to mid-off and that single brings up Smith's fifty. An innings of great importance for his team. It's been his presence that has stopped Sri Lanka from getting on the roll they've showed they could do in the Tests
back of a length and outside off, defended
shortish delivery on off stump, Bailey chops it to third man
worked away into the leg side, they want two and they get it. Smith is a master at dragging balls from outside off to the leg side, whether they kick, scream or just plain scowl at him
back of a length on off stump, defended
slaps a full and wide one at cover
gets up off his toes to slice a shortish delivery towards point
jumps back to flick a shortish delivery through midwicket.
shortish and outside off, cut to deep third man
fuller ball driven sweetly to the sweeper cover
back of a length and outside off, punched towards cover
starts off with a short delivery on off stump, drilled to long-on

oooh, the square leg umpire was in the line of fire. Does half a split to evade the ball, which then skips along on its merry way to the square leg boundary. Clumsy Sandakan stares after it, heartbroken
goes for the reverse sweep, taking the ball from leg stump

superb work at short leg! That was hit off the middle, more so off the middle after Smith had run down the track. Danushka Gunathilaka, the sub, reached to his left, popped the ball up and took it on the rebound all cool-like. Top innings from Smith, but he screams to the heavens for falling so close to the end of the chase.
shuffles back and with the ball on leg stump, he gets the easy option to flick it away and get two runs so he won't be on strike in the next over
back of a length and outside off, tapped to point
back of a length and outside off, cut to deep third man
mistakes the offcutter as a run-scoring opportunity and the cover drive nearly lobs back to Mathews
shortish and outside off, slices to deep third man
back of a length on leg stump, flicked away behind square

walks across towards a good length ball on off stump and gets an inside edge as he tries to defend. Even the fast bowlers, if they're willing to roll their fingers over the ball, are causing problems to the new batsman. These 32 runs may be the toughest Australia score on this tour, especially considering how badly they want them
top edge, but fine leg is on the boundary. Premeditates a sweep and ends up mistiming a short ball
poor line form Dilruwan, pitching on middle stump when the ball is spinning big. Great take from Kusal again
lovely sweep - first the big front stride, then the bat coming down on top of the ball and the wrists rolling over the ball to send it to deep square leg
tucked away towards deep square leg off the back foot
moves around the stumps now for a flatter ball on off stump, defended
great effort from Dilruwan, diving to his right, full-length, but the drive to long-on evades him and Bailey and Henriques have stolen two
flighted outside off - a much better length. It has Bailey prodding forward and the defensive shot results in an inside edge, not enough deliveries in that area

pops it straight to short leg! Do Sri Lanka have a chance here? Henriques went back to flick the ball - a shortish one - and he directs it to the fielder under the helmet more for an inside edge off the pad, but Gunathilaka keeps plucking catches off shots hit off the middle
has he picked the googly? It seemed like it, since he went back and committed to the flick when the line of the ball - had it been an orthodox delivery - demanded a cover drive
big turn! Sandakan lobs it up a set of stumps outside off, and since it is on a length, Bailey is fooled into going back to cut. Gets the biggest shock of his life when it hurtles back into him
tossed up outside off, driven through the covers
that's a googly, George! You don't need any room when it's pitched outside off and destined to spin away. Just about reaches it with the bottom of his bat and the cut shot gets him a couple

massive turn again as a good length ball pitches outside off and turns right across the right-hander and into the keeper's gloves down the leg side. Bailey wants to know why that wasn't a wide, umpire Dar says it pitched outside off
stays back and slaps a flatter delivery through to deep point
almost another super snap Gunathilaka at short leg! Bailey went back to flick, and nailed the shot. That's the only thing that saved him as the ball hits the fielder's shoulder and goes away
defends a good length ball down the pitch
goes back, looking to play off the pitch, and defends. Risky that when the length is so full on off stump
flighted on leg stump, driven to long-off
goes back to a length ball and blocks it with hard hands
goes for a big drive, but the ball dips on him and the outside edge wanders to backward point
a little short and outside off, cuts it away to the man in the deep

that's short, the wrist spinner, especially a young one, might have to stomach through a few of those. But Sandakan would have preferred one of those hadn't popped out at this time. Head was quite happy though, jumping back and pulling it away through midwicket
wide and full, Head was looking to drive through cover and gets an inside edge
picks the googly, waits on the back foot and pulls to mid-on
indulges in a reverse sweep, when the line of the ball was a little too close to middle stump. Had he missed it, he might just have been lbw
hangs back, and when the really full ball pitches and turns sharply, he is caught in no-man's land. Hurries into a defensive push, with an open face, and gets an outside edge

he's helped a short ball, down leg, down the throat of long leg! Bailey walks off looking shell-shocked. He could have had his pick of the ground - and this is a seriously large one - to belt the ball away, instead he gets a top edge and Sandakan takes an easy catch
tossed up on off, Faulkner nudges it to short midwicket
tentative forward defence from Faulkner as Perera loops the ball up outside off

oooh, that's tight. Faulkner goes back, his feet betraying his nerves, and does well to gently pat the ball behind square leg and away from the fielder under the helmet. Sri Lanka needed a few more close-in fielders in that over
he's worth his weight in tons of runs, Gunathilaka! Gets struck on the bare forearm with Faulkner playing a full-blooded pull
goes for a sweep despite the length behind short, and he was into the shot so early that the ball lobbed off the back of the bat and away over the wicketkeeper
tossed up, a little quick on leg stump, Faulkner goes for the sweep and it just misses leg stump. Wide called with the batsman having swept from outside off
shortish, which makes matters easy for a nervous batsman, can play from the crease, wait for the offbreak and play with it to deep square leg
shortish on off stump, defended
short and wide, slapped to short cover
comes on with the arm, but Head plays it well enough, backing away and cutting from the stumps
attempts a cut off a good length ball pitching on off stump and leaping away to the keeper's gloves

huge chance for a run-out but Dilruwan doesn't pick up the ball! Head was trying to flick, gets struck on the pad and wants to hide in the other end. Had come halfway down, with the non-striker did not move at all, he didn't want anything to do with it

Kusal is certain he's stumped Head! And it appears his back foot is in the air even as he tried to push back to safety! Beautiful bowling from Dilruwan, tossed it up just outside off, tempted the batsman forward to defend with hard, searching hands. Just delight for an offspinner to get a man out like that, not to mention the rapid work from the keeper. Kusal is doing a rip-roaring job
a little too full and Starc drives fluently to long-off
quick, full, right on middle and off, Faulkner comes forward tentatively and gets an inside edge past short leg. Streaky, but effective
nicely tossed up on off stump, Starc drives it to long-off again, short cover didn't put in the dive
outside edge, squirts away to the sweeper cover and scores are level
goes for the big old slog sweep, and is beaten by the turn
goes back to a flatter ball and pushes to short cover
driven to short cover again as a quicker, fuller one comes at him on leg stump

Australia win. It's short and a shade outside off, punched through the covers - punches the air as he runs as well - and signs the match off. Winnings runs, and becoming the fastest to 100 ODI wickets in the same game. Starc, you beauty.
